sentences: Inimõigused on rahvusvahelised ja on kõigile ühised.
Ta jäi kõigele vaatamata oma arvamuse juurde.
context: The Estonian word 'kõik' is a versatile pronoun and determiner with multiple meanings. In the plural form it means 'everyone' or 'everybody', referring to people collectively (e.g., 'kõigile ühised' - shared by everyone). In the singular form it means 'everything', referring to things or concepts as a whole (e.g., 'kõigele vaatamata' - despite everything). As a determiner, it means 'all' (e.g., 'kõik nõukogu liikmed' - all board members). It can also be used idiomatically at the end of sentences as an emphatic final particle similar to saying 'full stop' in English.
